sen.j: 嵯峨ぎく（さがぎく）は、キク科の多年草。
sen.e: Saga-giku chrysanthemums (Chrysanthemum grandiflorum cv.Saga) are a perennial plant belonging to the family Asteraceae.
Saga-giku chrysanthemums (Chrysanthemum grandiflorum cv.Saga) are perennial plants belonging to the family Asteraceae.
Saga-giku chrysanthemums (Chrysanthemum grandiflorum cv.Saga) are perennial plants belonging to the family Asteraceae.
Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 京都府嵯峨野の地に源を発する古典ぎく。
sen.e: They are old chrysanthemums originally from Sagano in Kyoto prefecture.
They are old chrysanthemums originally from Sagano in Kyoto prefecture.
They are old chrysanthemums originally from Sagano in Kyoto prefecture.

sen.j: その名称から、京都を強くイメージしているといわれる。
sen.e: It is said that Saga-giku chrysanthemums give a strong image of Kyoto because of their name.
sen.cmt: 原文「京都を強くイメージしている」とありますが、菊そのものが京都をイメージすることはできないため、そのままでは意味不明です。ここでは「（名前を聞いた人が）京都をイメージする」と解釈しました。
sen.e: It is said that Saga-giku chrysanthemums give a strong image of Kyoto because of their name.
It is said that Saga-giku chrysanthemums give a strong image of Kyoto because of their name.

sen.j: 濃赤色、桃色、白色、黄色などの花が10月から11月に開花する。
sen.e: Flowers in dark red, pink, white and yellow bloom in October and November.
Flowers in dark red, pink, white, and yellow bloom during October and November.
Flowers in dark red, pink, white, and yellow bloom during October and November.
Prefectural Flowers
Prefectural Flowers
Prefectural Flowers

sen.j: 京都府の花はしだれ桜であるが、草花（花とする見方もある）としてナデシコと共に1990年3月6日制定された。
sen.e: Although the flower representing Kyoto prefecture is a weeping cherry tree, Saga-giku chrysanthemums and Dianthus were designated as flowering plants in March 1990 (some people also consider them flowers).

Although the flower representing Kyoto prefecture is from a weeping cherry tree, Saga-giku chrysanthemums and Dianthus were designated as flowering plants in March 1990 (some people also consider them flowers).

Although the flower representing Kyoto prefecture is a weeping cherry tree, Saga-giku chrysanthemums and Dianthus were designated as flowering plants in March 6, 1990 (some people also consider them flowers).
